info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:44AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Greenville, northern Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 344 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Pickens, or near Jocassee Gorges, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Slater-Marietta, Six Mile, Lake Keowee, Jocassee Gorges, Jones Gap State Park, Devils Fork State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Table Rock State Park and Caesars Head State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
